definition: Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]

sentences.english: Ouyang Xiu Systematize ZhengXuan's sub-system of poems in a systematic order.
sentences.chinese: 欧阳修还对郑玄《诗谱》的世次体系进行了系统整理。

sentences.english: Zheng Xuan's Jinxue has exerted profound influences on traditional Chinese culture and academia.
sentences.chinese: 郑玄经学在中国传统的文化学术史上影响非常深远。

definition: Zhao Qi (-201 BC), early Han commentator on Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3]
Yang Xiong (53 BC-18 AD), scholar, poet and lexicographer, author of the first Chinese dialect dictionary 方言[Fang1 yan2]
Wang Chong (27-97), rationalist and critical philosopher
Dong Zhongshu (179-104 BC), philosopher influential in establishing Confucianism as the established system of values of former Han dynasty
Xu Shen (-147) the compiler of the original Han dynasty dictionary Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written during Han dynasty, same as 公羊傳|公羊传[Gong1 yang2 Zhuan4]
Ban Gu (32-92), Eastern Han dynasty historian, wrote the Dynastic History of Western Han 漢書|汉书
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
Wang Su (c. 195-256), classical scholar of Cao Wei dynasty, believed to have forged several classical texts
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
Luxuriant Dew of the Spring and Autumn Annals, ideological tract by Han dynasty political philosopher Dong Zhongshu 董仲舒[Dong3 Zhong4 shu1]
